overview: This subject introduces the mainstream methods and techniques for the identification, modelling and analysis of business processes. Students will learn techniques for analysing historical business data through the lens of a process. The methods, techniques and tools for business process modelling and analysis are relevant for the design and analysis of process-aware information systems. The content in this subject is complemented with hands-on tutorials with software tools.
ilo: Describe and apply business process modelling techniques
Use appropriate business process modelling techniques to best understand a business context and need for an information system
Design and analyse information systems using a business process' lense
Document business processes for information systems design and analysis
generic_skills: Enhanced ability to work in a team

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: One group-based report, with 2 to 3 group members, approximately 2000 words, requiring approximately 20-25 hours of work per student. Due mid-semester. Intended Learning Outcomes (ILO's) 1, 2, 3 and 4 are addressed in the report.

One group-based report, with 2 to 3 group members,  approximately 4500 words, requiring approximately 45-50 hours of work per student. Due end of semester. ILO's 1, 2, 3 and 4 are addressed in the report.
One written 2 hour open-book examination. ILO's 1, 2 and 3 are addressed in the exam.
assessment.hurdle: To pass the subject, students must obtain at least 50% of the marks available in the examination.

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, comprising of 1 x 2-hour lecture and 1 x 1-hour tutorial per week
